title: Dog Bites Woman On Face As She Steps Out Of Toilet In Karnataka Court
content: A stray dog viciously attacked a woman on the premises of a court in Karnataka, leaving her bleeding profusely, said the police.

title: Nearly 900 Arrested At London Palestine Action Protest: UK Police

title: 'Incidence Rate Entirely Normal Considering Operational Scale': Air India CEO
content: Air India chief Campbell Wilson has said that in the context of Air India Group's scale and size, the "incidence rate is entirely normal" amid incidents involving some of its aircraft in recent times.

title: "4 Acres? I Have 40": M Kharge Chides Farmer For Crop Damage Complaint
content: A farmer who came to Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge to complain about his crop, got an earful recently. The man had visited Mr Kharge's home in Kalaburagi -- a region still reeling under rain which has taken a massive toll on the crops.

title: Drone Launched From Yemen By Houthis Hits Airport, Says Israel
content: A drone launched from Yemen by the Houthi militant group has hit Israel's southern airport, closing the airspace and halting flights, the Israeli military said Sunday.

title: Row Over Ex-Party Leader's "Jersey Cow" Remark For Tejashwi Yadav's Wife
content: First, the Prime Minister was abused. Now, Tejashwi Yadav's wife. With Bihar elections still a few months away, it appears it's open season for insults.

title: 'Spurt In Consumption To Meet Fiscal Deficit Target Of 4.4%': Nirmala Sitharaman

title: Between Shelling And Floods, Jammu's Border Villages Plead For Safer Future
content: Jammu's border villages, which have long been terrorised by cross-border shelling, are braving an even more serious threat today as flash floods caused by unprecedented monsoon rains have left their homes broken and farmlands ruined

title: Israeli PM Netanyahu Says Army "Deepening" Assault On Gaza City
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Sunday that the army was "deepening" its assault in and around Gaza City, as it seeks to step up pressure on the Palestinian militant group Hamas.

title: Recognising Palestinian State May Trigger "Unilateral" Action, Warns Israel
content: Israel's foreign minister branded a recent international push to recognise Palestinian statehood a "mistake" on Sunday and warned it could trigger an unspecified unilateral response.

title: 'Child's Testimony Alone Can Secure Conviction If Reliable': Delhi High Court
content: The Delhi High Court has upheld a man's 12-year jail term for raping a 10-year-old girl in 2017, saying the child's testimony inspired confidence and was reliable, and the conviction could rest upon it alone.

title: Andhra Pradesh Government Pushes For CBI Probe Into 2017 Death Of Tribal Girl
content: The Andhra Pradesh government has once again pushed for a Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) probe into the death of a 15-year-old tribal girl in 2017, a case that has been mired in controversy and legal battles for years.

title: Video: Prisoners Attack Jail Official With Hammer, Escape; Rearrested
content: Two remand prisoners who staged a dramatic escape from Chodavaram Sub-Jail in Anakapalli district were re-arrested within 24 hours following a swift operation by the local police.

title: Kolkata Horror: Woman Gang-Raped By 2 Men After Her Birthday Party
content: A 20-year-old woman was allegedly gang-raped by two of her acquaintances on her birthday in an upscale locality in Kolkata, police said on Sunday.

title: Preparations In Full Swing Ahead Of PM Modi's Expected Manipur Visit
content: Preparations are in full swing in Manipur for Prime Minister Narendra Modi's expected visit this week - for the first time since ethnic violence erupted in 2023.

title: Pakistan Connection Of Missing Girl Found On Delhi-Bihar Train
content: A missing minor girl who was rescued from a train earlier this week has a Pakistan connection. The incident came to light on September 4.

title: Adani Group Plans To Invest $60 Billion In Power Sector Till 2032
content: Industrialist Gautam Adani-led Adani Group is looking to invest around $60 billion up to FY32 in power sector, especially in renewables, generation and transmission/distribution.

title: Buzz Over New Manipur Government Formation After Governor, BJP Leaders Meet
content: In Manipur, a meeting between senior Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leaders, including former Chief Minister N Biren Singh, and Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla has fuelled speculation over the possible formation of a new government in the state.

content: The Opposition party also claimed that these were "telltale signs of guilt of Maharashtra election fraud" and there were coordinated moves by various arms of the government to suppress information

content: The Lignite Mine 1A in Neyveli, Talabira II and III coal mines in Odisha and Barsingar lignite mine in Rajasthan have got the first place in the survey of lignite and coal-based open cast mines

content: The incident took place at around 10:45 a.m. when a hanging electric wire came in contact with the Ganpati idol during the immersion procession

content: The cloudburst occurred at Syori Phal Patti in Yamuna Valley in the evening, and sludge from a flooded stream rushed downwards, inflicting damage in low-lying areas

content: The former JNU student has been languishing in jail without trial and bail since 2020 for his alleged involvement in Delhi riots, a charge he denies vehemently

content: The listing of sub-castes in alphabetical order, rather than under each caste as one category, has riled many communities

content: According to information, the CPS team visited the high-security ward of Tihar and spoke with the prisoners there

content: All of them were booked under Medical Termination of Pregnancy (MTP) Act, 1971, by Kurusilapattu police in Tirupattur.

title: Youth held for selling painkiller tablets in Vellore
content: Investigations revealed the suspect Vishwa was selling the tablets for youth and students in the area.

content: More than one acre of forest land was gutted in the incident. The hills are home to spotted deer, sloth bear, peacocks, monkeys and Indian gaur.

title: Arts and Science college in Vaniyambadi holds Graduation day
content: The executive director of VIT highlighted the importance of women‚Äôs empowerment and cited women achievers as examples

content: About 3.19 lakh candidates will take the exam tomorrow for appointment as teachers for class IX and class X in state-run schools. The recruitment on the last occasion in 2016 was riddled with irregularities and corruption

title: Haryana government transfers 20 IAS officers, 1 HCS officer in major reshuffle
content: Munish Sharma, Deputy Commissioner, Charkhi Dadri, has been transferred and posted as Secretary, Haryana Board of School Education, Bhiwani, relieving Munish Nagpal of the charge

content: How productive was the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit? Did a meeting between China, Russia and India at Tianjin signal a change in relations? Did U.S. moves on tariffs and sanctions prompt this? What are the leaders saying?

content: According to the BMC, 18,186 Ganapati idols, 1,058 of ‚Äòsarvajanik mandals‚Äô (local community groups) and 258 of Goddess idols, were immersed in natural water bodies and artificial ponds created by the civic body till 9 p.m.

title: Rajendra Arlekar | Saffron guard
content: The Kerala Governor, a former functionary of the BJP, faces criticism for ‚Äòsaffronising‚Äô education and violating constitutional propriety

title: BCCI adds ‚Çπ14,627 crore in five years, ‚Çπ4,193 crore in last financial year: Report
content: Aided by IPL earnings and ICC distributions, the BCCI posted a surplus of ‚Çπ1,623.08 crore for 2023-24, up from ‚Çπ1,167.99 crore in the previous year, according to the report

title: T.N. Health Minister flags air travelers‚Äô woes, seeks Airbus services on key routes
content: Mr.Subramanian highlighted that, in recent times, passengers flying to Madurai from Chennai airport have been experiencing severe mental stress due to inadequate seating in shuttle buses

title: Opposition parties criticise DMK government for deterioration of law and order situation in T.N.
content: AIADMK general secretary Edappadi K. Palaniswami says the Chief Minister M.K. Stalin-led government has failed to maintain law and order and DMK functionaries being involved in criminal activities has become a regular occurrence

title: Tamil Nadu government introduces overseas scholarship for Muslim students
content: The scholarship will assist their higher studies if they are admitted to institutions ranked within the top 250 in the Global QS rankings

title: J&K parties seek removal of Waqf chairperson Darakshan Andrabi over ‚ÄòNational Emblem plaque‚Äô row
content: Chairperson placing a plaque with the National Emblem at the shrine sparks protests; BJP, Shiv Sena demand action against those who vandalised plaque

title: Science-based problem-solving should take an inclusive approach, says academic
content: Given the lack of adequate scientists and doctors across the globe, he points out that the role of community health workers was paramount and their access to right set of tools critical

title: Dinner gatherings at PM, BJP chief‚Äôs residences cancelled over floods in Punjab and other regions
content: While Friday brought some respite from the relentless rain, several northern Indian States grapple with the destruction left behind by the monsoon in the most affected areas

title: Supreme Court panel on students‚Äô mental health gets State Nodal Officers; over 1 lakh survey responses received
content: The 12-member National Task Force was formed after parents of students who had died by suicide in higher education campuses had sought relief from the Supreme Court

title: Declining budget for MGNREGS means reduced income for women in rural India, say activists
content: Given the Finance Ministry‚Äôs directive capping the expenditure in the first two quarters at 60% of the total available budget, the Centre has only ‚Çπ79 crore under the programme for the month of September

title: Inside Hyundai raid: How a monthlong op led US immigration to Georgia & what's next
content: A large-scale immigration raid at a Hyundai-LG battery plant in Georgia led to the detention of hundreds, including over 300 South Korean workers, sparking diplomatic concerns and scrutiny of visa practices. The operation, targeting unlawful employment, halted construction at the multibillion-dollar EV battery project.

title: Manipur pact: NH-2 reopening sparks tension; Kuki groups warn against 'free passage'
content: The reopening of National Highway-2, a vital supply route, has stirred unease in Manipur's peace process. Kuki-Zo armed groups, KNO and UPF, cautioned against interpreting it as acceptance of unrestricted movement between communities. This follows a renewed ceasefire agreement with the Centre, focusing on territorial integrity and a political solution.

title: Rain fury: Floods rip into Punjab's dwindling green cover, 5 lakh trees uprooted
content: Devastating floods in Punjab have significantly hampered efforts to expand the state's diminishing green cover, resulting in the loss of 4,94,956 trees across 776 hectares. With forest cover already low at 3.7% of its geographical area, the floods have deepened Punjab's ecological stress and caused an estimated damage of over Rs 360.5 lakh to the forest and wildlife preservation department.

title: GST 2.0 savings: Price cuts across all major brands - Creta, Thar, Nexon & more
content: The implementation of GST 2.0 has led to significant price reductions across the Indian auto sector, with car manufacturers passing on the benefits to consumers. Savings range from Rs 65,000 to Rs 8.9 lakh, impacting models from Mahindra, Tata, Toyota, Skoda, Renault, BMW, Mercedes-Benz, and Hyundai.

title: US recession: Moody‚Äôs warns average Americans, these states are at risk
content: Mark Zandi of Moody's warns that the US economy is nearing recession, with states comprising a third of the nation's GDP at high risk. Sluggish consumer spending, tariffs, and housing market struggles contribute to this vulnerability. Revised job reports reveal a hiring slowdown, adding to concerns about rising inflation and eroding consumer purchasing power.

title: Hyundai raid: US, South Korea seal deal for workers' release; what we know so far
content: South Korea and the United States finalized an agreement for the release of South Korean nationals detained during an immigration raid at a Hyundai plant in Georgia. Over 300 South Koreans were among the 475 individuals taken into custody during the operation, which targeted a plant under construction for electric vehicle battery production.

title: 'Abandon hateful politics': Mayawati warns of 'conspiracy' in UP; slams US tariffs
content: Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati expressed concerns about a conspiracy to disrupt harmony in Uttar Pradesh. She urged governments to abandon hateful politics. Mayawati reviewed the party's organizational campaign in Lucknow. She criticized Donald Trump's tariff hike on Indian goods. Mayawati called it 'Trump tariff terror' emphasising the need for reforms to address poverty and unemployment.

title: 'Frustrating': Shreyas Iyer breaks silence on snub; reveals what players feel when left out
content: Shreyas Iyer addressed the mental challenges of squad omissions, emphasising self-belief and team success. Despite being left out of the Asia Cup 2025 squad, he stressed ethical work habits and supporting teammates. India, the defending champions, are gearing up for the Asia Cup, revealing their new jersey and intensifying practice sessions for their title defense.

title: AI godfather warns: Hinton on AI‚Äôs ‚Äònuclear‚Äô threat; 'can help create bioweapons'
content: Geoffrey Hinton, a prominent AI figure, expresses serious concerns about AI's potential dangers, shifting from promoting its development to warning about its threats. He envisions AI empowering individuals to create bioweapons, akin to nuclear threats, and surpassing human emotional capabilities. While Hinton believes AI possesses genuine intelligence, his former colleague Yann LeCun holds a contrasting view on its limitations.

title: 'Decided to resign': Japan PM Ishiba steps down; hopes to avoid LDP split
content: Under mounting pressure from the LDP following a significant defeat in the upper house elections, Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba announced his resignation. This decision, made after resisting calls for over a month, avoids a potential no-confidence vote. Ishiba's short tenure was marked by declining approval ratings and economic challenges, including rising rice prices, leading to his swift downfall.

title: Nepal social media ban: Facebook, Twitter among 26 apps blocked; Govt explains why
content: Nepal has banned major social media platforms like Facebook, YouTube, and X after they failed to register with the government by the given deadline. This decision follows a Supreme Court directive to regulate online platforms and monitor content.

title: PhysicsWallah IPO: Edtech giant files draft papers; eyes raising Rs 3,820 crore
content: PhysicsWallah, the edtech platform, has filed updated draft papers with Sebi to raise Rs 3,820 crore through an IPO. The IPO includes a fresh issue of shares and an offer for sale by promoters Alakh Pandey and Prateek Boob. The funds will be used for physical infrastructure, technology, marketing, and investments in subsidiaries, aiming to fuel expansion and growth initiatives.

title: NFL news: Mike Evans to play against Atlanta Falcons? Bucs WR cleared to play
content: Mike Evans is set to start for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in tonight's game against the Atlanta Falcons, confirmed by head coach Todd Bowles. Despite an earlier "rest" designation, Evans is ready to lead the Buccaneers' passing attack, especially with Chris Godwin sidelined. Expectations are high for Evans, who aims to continue his streak of 1,000-yard seasons.

title: 'Strength of BJP': PM Modi sits in last row during NDA workshop; MP shares photo
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi participated in a Bharatiya Janata Party workshop at the Parliament complex, emphasizing the importance of every party worker. The two-day event included sessions on the party's history and ways to improve efficiency for parliamentarians.

title: Watch: Indian woman caught shoplifting at Target; gasps, folds hands
content: A bodycam video surfaced showing an Indian woman, identified as Gujarati, being interrogated by police at a Target store for shoplifting. ‚ÄãIn the process of the interrogation, it was revealed that she was a serial shoplifter from that particular Target store, but that was the first time she was stopped. She admitted that she was going to resell some of the items she stole from the Target store.

title: 'Local Boy!': Suryakumar quips as crowd chants 'Samson, Samson' in Dubai ‚Äì Watch
content: Suryakumar Yadav's playful banter with Sanju Samson during Team India's Asia Cup 2025 practice in Dubai injected humor into the camp. Samson, vying for an opening spot, received strong fan support, while the team intensely trained for the tournament. The BCCI unveiled the official jersey, emphasising the team's determination to defend their title as Asian champions.

title: NFL news: Will Aaron Rodgers play against New York Jets tonight?
content: Aaron Rodgers is set to lead the Pittsburgh Steelers against the New York Jets in their 2025 season opener. Fully recovered from offseason rest, Rodgers aims to showcase his experience and precision, targeting key receivers in critical plays. Coach Tomlin emphasizes Rodgers' ability to dictate the game's flow, making him central to the Steelers' offensive strategy.

title: 'Slapped 50‚Äì60 times': Classmates assault UP law student inside private university
content: In Lucknow's Chinhat, a law student was allegedly assaulted and threatened by a group of fellow students inside his university campus. The victim, Shikhar, was attacked in a car, enduring physical abuse and intimidation. An FIR has been lodged, and police are investigating the incident, which has left the student traumatized and fearing for his safety.

title: Who is Shigeru Ishiba? Japan‚Äôs PM who steps down; Here's all you need to know
content: Shigeru Ishiba resigned as Japan's Prime Minister after less than a year in office, triggered by the Liberal Democratic Party's electoral setbacks. His decision follows a historic defeat in parliamentary elections and pressure from rivals. Ishiba will initiate a party leadership contest to pick his successor, paving the way for new leadership contenders.

title: Bridge collapses in Iraq: 2 dead, several injured; rescue ops stretch overnight
content: In Iraq's southern region, a section of an under-construction bridge collapsed on the Karbala-Baghdad route, resulting in at least two fatalities and several injuries. Rescue teams worked overnight, extricating seven individuals and recovering the deceased from the debris. Among the injured were Syrian and Afghan nationals, highlighting concerns about safety protocols in Iraq's burgeoning construction sector.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Team India unveils new jersey with powerful message - Watch
content: India's Asia Cup 2025 preparations are in full swing as the BCCI and ACC revealed the team's official jersey through a dynamic video. Featuring captain Suryakumar Yadav and key players, the video emphasises the team's determination to defend their title.

title: 'Best use of military': Vance defends US strike on Venezuelan cartel boat
content: US Vice President JD Vance defended a US strike on a Venezuelan drug-cartel boat, dismissing concerns about its legality. The strike, which killed 11 people, targeted a vessel allegedly carrying narcotics, with President Trump confirming the operation. Questions arise regarding international law compliance, as the US military identified the crew as members of the Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua.

title: GST revamp: FM Sitharaman says Rs 48,000 cr shortfall won't hit public finances
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is confident that increased consumption following GST rate cuts will offset the estimated revenue shortfall of Rs 48,000 crore. She anticipates the GST overhaul and strong Q1 GDP growth will boost the economy, potentially exceeding the projected 6.3‚Äì6.8% growth for FY26. The government aims to maintain its fiscal deficit target of 4.4% of GDP.

title: Massachusetts thunderstorm: Tornado warnings, forecasts, safety tips & more
content: A Thunderstorm Watch has been issued for nine Massachusetts counties, warning of potential damaging winds, hail, frequent lightning, and localized flooding. The storms are expected to develop in the mid-afternoon and intensify eastward, posing risks of power outages and property damage. Residents are urged to stay alert, monitor updates, and take precautions to ensure safety during this severe weather event.

title: Watch: Star Australian batter turns bowler, grabs hat-trick to win T20 final
content: Marnus Labuschagne showcased his all-round abilities in the KFC T20 Max competition, grabbing a hat-trick for Redlands against Valleys to secure a thrilling victory in the final. This performance came shortly after he smashed a century in just 57 balls, demonstrating his desire to score runs wherever he plays.

title: UP‚Äôs ‚Äòfake IAS‚Äô flaunted photos with CMs, governors; lived VIP life with Range Rover
content: Saurabh Tripathi, masquerading as an IAS officer, was arrested after a businessman grew suspicious of his claims. Tripathi used social media and forged documents to create a false persona, even acquiring luxury vehicles with fake government plates. Investigations are underway across multiple states to uncover the full extent of his deception and identify victims who were promised official favors.

title: 'Lost lives cannot return': Ukraine PM after Russia's largest drone strike
content: Russia launched its largest aerial assault on Kyiv since the war began, resulting in casualties and damage to a key government building. Ukraine retaliated by targeting Russia's Druzhba oil pipeline. Amidst stalled peace talks, international calls for tougher sanctions against Russia are intensifying, with President Zelenskyy expressing willingness to meet President Putin.

title: NFL game tonight: Full match list and starting time revealed; where to watch live
content: The NFL season ignites with Week 1 clashes, featuring Jets vs. Steelers and Patriots vs. Raiders. Key matchups include Colts vs. Dolphins, Jaguars vs. Panthers, and Saints vs. Cardinals. The Giants face the Commanders, while the Falcons battle the Buccaneers, and Browns take on Bengals. Expect electrifying plays and fresh rivalries as teams vie for early dominance.

title: India men's compound archery team wins first-ever gold at World Archery Championships
content: India's men's compound archery team made history by clinching their first-ever gold at the World Archery Championships, defeating France. The team comprised Aman Saini, Rishabh Yadav, and Prathamesh Bhalchandra Fuge. Rishabh Yadav also secured a silver medal with Jyothi Surekha Vennam in the compound mixed team event, losing to the Netherlands in the final after a successful run.

title: Ajit Agarkar: Taking bullets with a smile in Indian cricket‚Äôs hottest seat
content: Ajit Agarkar‚Äôs stint as India‚Äôs chief selector has been defined by bold calls, grooming young talent, and delivering results ‚Äî including two ICC titles. Former selector Devang Gandhi told TOI that selection is ‚Äúmore elimination than choice,‚Äù stressing communication, long-term vision, and alignment with the captain as keys to balancing criticism and building for the future.

title: Woman killed for rejecting arranged marriage
content: In a tragic incident in New Delhi, a 20-year-old woman was strangled to death by her father, Gayyur, for resisting an arranged marriage. Gayyur, 48, confessed to the crime and surrendered to the police. The young woman's desire to marry someone of her choice was met with opposition from her parents, leading to the fatal confrontation.

title: Tua Tagovailoa vs Colts: Injury update sparks doubt; Dolphins QB status
content: Tua Tagovailoa will play in the Miami Dolphins‚Äô Week 1 matchup against the Indianapolis Colts despite past injury concerns. The quarterback confirmed his readiness, while Tyreek Hill is also expected to suit up. Get the latest injury update, game details, and what to expect from Miami‚Äôs offense in their season opener at Lucas Oil Stadium.

title: Married woman, teen lover murder 6-year-old who saw them in 'compromising position'
content: In a shocking incident in Sikandra Rau, a six-year-old girl, Urvi, was murdered after she discovered a woman and a teenage boy in a compromising situation. Fearing Urvi would reveal their secret, the pair strangled her and disposed of her body in a well. The woman has been arrested, and the boy detained, with police investigations ongoing.

title: Kolkata horror: 20-yr-old 'abducted', gang-raped by 2 friends
content: In Haridevpur, Kolkata, a 20-year-old woman was allegedly abducted from her residence by two friends, Chandan Mallick and Debangshu Biswas, after refusing a birthday party invitation. The accused then took her to Malancha, where she was reportedly raped multiple times.

title: 'Crap note': Trump aide Navarro reacts to X flagging his post as 'hypocrisy'; slams India again
content: Former White House advisor Peter Navarro has accused India of profiteering from Russian oil purchases, alleging that India didn't buy any before the Ukraine invasion and is now fueling Russia's war efforts. These remarks have been strongly refuted by India's Ministry of External Affairs, which dismissed them as inaccurate and misleading.

title: Russia hits Kyiv with drones, missiles killing 2; Ukraine attacks Bryansk oil pipeline
content: A mass Russian drone and missile strike on Kyiv resulted in at least two fatalities, including a one-year-old child, and multiple injuries, with smoke seen near the Cabinet of Ministers building. This marks the second major attack on Kyiv in recent weeks, escalating concerns. Simultaneously, Ukraine targeted the Druzhba oil pipeline in Russia's Bryansk region, causing significant damage.

title: Rajasthan: Army uses drone to rescue man trapped in Ayad River - watch
content: The Indian Army's Battle Axe Division showcased remarkable ingenuity by rescuing a 30-year-old man stranded in Udaipur's Ayad River. Utilizing drones for remote coordination, the Army ensured a safe evacuation amidst the river's dangerous surge. Shared by Konark Corps, the rescue highlights the force's embrace of technology for rapid response in emergencies.

title: Exclusive: Jason Holder calls for 'fair compensation' to counter lure of T20 leagues
content: Jason Holder, despite not playing Test cricket for over a year, expresses his unwavering desire to return to the West Indies Test team, emphasizing his passion for international cricket and the significance of Test cricket as the pinnacle of the sport.

title: Jharkhand: Hardcore Naxalite carrying Rs 10L bounty killed in Chaibasa
content: In a significant operation, security forces neutralized a key naxalite leader, Amit Hansda, in an encounter in Jharkhand's Chaibasa on Sunday. Hansda, a Zonal Commander, had a reward of Rs 10 lakh on his head. The joint operation by the COBRA battalion and district police also led to the recovery of weapons, including an SLR rifle.

title: Former Junior No. 1 Sankar Subramanian stays grounded as India seek badminton revival
content: Indian badminton faces a period of underwhelming performances, but Sankar Subramanian, a former junior World No. 1, expresses optimism about the future. Despite recent setbacks, he believes the next generation holds immense potential. Sankar emphasizes the need for improved grassroots programs, high-performance training, and comprehensive support systems to consistently compete at the highest level and regain India's dominance in badminton.

title: Gurgaon: ‚ÄòCremated‚Äô man walks home a day later
content: Gurgaon police were left baffled after Poojan Prasad, presumed dead and cremated by his son, returned home a day later. Police had identified a mutilated body as Prasad based on a missing person report and family claims. The cremation took place before Prasad's brother-in-law spotted him alive.

title: 'Let's go!': Sunil Chhetri on Virat Kohli's fitness: drops a massive hint
content: Sunil Chhetri, former India football captain, has revealed details about Virat Kohli's fitness. Kohli shared his fitness test scores with Chhetri. Chhetri compared Kohli's dedication to Cristiano Ronaldo. He highlighted their relentless pursuit of excellence. Chhetri emphasized the importance of focusing on the present. He also noted how Kohli and Ronaldo consistently strive for improvement. Their commitment is truly remarkable.

content: Ohio State coach Ryan Day was candid in his postgame assessment of the drubbing of FCS Grambling . day said it was "not a matchup game" that was the theme of week 2, which featured multiple contenders playing FCS opponents or other unranked, lower-level teams .

title: What we learned from Chelsea's and Arsenal's openers: Blues still strong, Smith a star
content: the 2025-26 women's super league (WSL) season is up and running . reigning champions Chelsea and champions league holders arsenal lighting up the first two matches of the new campaign . the blues claimed a domestic treble without losing a single game last term .
